div.p: The PustefixEditor is a project browser and editor shipped with . It allows you to browse the structure of targets, pages and include parts of the projects in your environment. Additionally you can create images and include parts and edit them.

Note: The source code of the editor is not a good example for writing applications with . This is due to the fact that this part of the code is quite old. For an example that should always be up to date with respect to the current features of see the sample1 application in the CVS checkout.

Most people will start the editor directly from the page where they want to start editing. Another way is to start the editor application directly (by entering cmscore.HOSTNAME.DOMAINNAME in the case of the CVS checkout or cmsskel.HOSTNAME.DOMAINNAME in the case of the skeleton environment). In that case you would start (after a successful login) with the project selection page.
But for now let's assume you want to change an include on the first page of the sample1 application.

td.stdimg: The first page of the sample1 application

td.p: In the red box you see the edit console divided into three different sections. Press the button with the pen symbol in section 1. This button also shows the tooltip Switch edit mode ON when you move the mouse pointer over it. Now, the application will change into edit mode and look like the next image. The button itself changes into a pen with a red cross. Pressing it again switches the edit mode off.

Note: The edit mode button only works if you set the editmode property (decribed here) to true. Instead of switching to edit mode by using the edit console, you can alternatively start by appending __editmode=admin or switch off by appending __editmode=0 to the URL.

tr.td: Section 2 can be used to show the last DOM response tree from the business logic that was used to render the current page. Note that this DOM tree is only stored for some time in the system which is usually much shorter than the time the session is valid. (The skeleton environment defines this timout to be 10 minutes for test mode, and 20 seconds for production mode - but the whole feature is not available in production mode anyway, so the 20 seconds should be no problem)
Section 3 is only visible if you have declared a record_dir here. Also have a look at the test client documentation for more information about it.

td.stdimg: The same page after the change into edit mode. Note the red brackets surrounding the include parts.

tr.td: Now the application is in edit mode. In edit mode every include part is framed by red curly brackets. Remember that include parts can be nested. After each closing curly bracket there is a small box with a pen symbol. Moving with the mouse over it shows the tool tip "Edit include: 'PART' in file 'INCLUDEFILE'". Pressing the box opens the pustefix editor in a new window starting with the login page. After successful login the include is automatically opened in the Includes page and can be edited in the editor applet.
